post.summary: Simulates the creation of direct deposit
Simulates a financial request (PIN debit) transaction with optional cash back

post.description:
The following amounts set in the fraudstream request model can be used for testing. xx can be any number to complete the amount.
xx.01Simulate success
xx.02Simulate decline
xx.04Simulate bad request with unknown response properties
xx.05Simulate internal server error with unknown response properties
xx.10Simulate not performed

post.summary: Simulates internal transaction messages coming from auth service

post.description:
The following amounts set in the auth, reversal, clearing requests can be used for testing. XX can be any number to complete the amount.
XX.11Simulate decline
XX.13Simulate address verification override
XX.22Simulate a delayed response or timeout. Set XX to a number in seconds for the delay.
XX.23Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for invalid amount.
XX.24Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for insufficient funds.
XX.25Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for transaction not permitted.
XX.26Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for suspected fraud.
XX.27Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for amount limit exceed.
XX.28Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for transaction count limit exceed.
XX.29Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for duplicate transaction.
XX.33Simulate partial approval returning half of the actual amount rounded down (future use)
XX.37Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for stop payment.
XX.41Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for closed account.
XX.42Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for invalid card.
XX.44Server Error
XX.46Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for soft decline authentication required.
XX.48Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for no credit account.
XX.52Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for no savings account.
XX.55Empty Response
XX.57Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for revocation authorization order.
XX.66Empty JIT gateway response
XX.77Amount exceeded
XX.79Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for invalid merchant.
XX.88401 Unauthorized
XX.93Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for expired card.
XX.94Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for no checking account.
XX.97Simulate a JIT gateway response with decision reason code for revocation all authorization order.
XX.99Forced chunked encoding

post.summary: Query Card with Tabapay for AVS CVV details
post.description:
The following PANS return different push enablement scenarios
999Security code not matched response
9424/0005/9997/8001/0000/0002Simulate Fast funds enablement to Next day
4242/1119/0061 Simulate Fast Funds enablement to Few Business days
1111/3333/5555 Simulate Disabling the Pushtocard enablement

The following amounts will result in failure status of the transaction
11.77Failed transaction
22.77Failed transaction
33.77Failed transaction

post.summary: Validates transaction against auto commando mode and its Velocity Control Rules

amount.description: Default is same amount as original GPA pending credit

timeout_millis.description: Total timeout in milliseconds for gateway processing

url.description: 250 char max. Empty string (disabled). Must be HTTPS.

basic_auth_username.description: 50 char max. Required if URL is present

basic_auth_password.description: 50 char max. Required if URL is present. Minimum 20 chars with upper and lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols

identifier for card issued by MQ

server_session_id.description: A string that identifies the backend session. Provided by Google pay backend.

client_session_id.description: A string that identifies the client session. Provided by Google pay backend.

token_setting.description: 1 => Tokenization will be attempted.; 0 =>Tokenization will not be attempted.

card_setting.description: 1 => FPAN save will be attempted.; 0 => FPAN save will not be attempted.

public_wallet_id.description: String identifying the device-scoped Google Pay wallet that will receive the token. Provided by Google Pay backend.

public_device_id.description: String identifying the Android device that will receive the token. Provided by Google Pay backend

card_token.description: identifier for card issued by MQ

integrator_id.description: A Google-assigned string that uniquely identifies both the integrator that is initiating the session and the issuer of the payment card.

token.description: The unique identifier of the merchant

The unique identifier of the merchant

kid.description: The ID for the JWS Public Key of the key pair used to generate signature.

protected.description: JWS Protected Headers, contains the Header Parameters that are integrity protected by the JWS Signature.

payload.description: JWS payload which includes the message to be sent.

state.description: Unique state associated with the token. MQ will return a UUID here.

secret.description: Must contain upper and lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols

basic_auth_password.description: Required if URL is present; must contain upper and lowercase letters, numbers, and symbols

custom_header.description: Custom headers to be passed along with request
